title: How to Make Banana Chocolate Chip Baked Doughnuts

steps.headline: Mix the wet ingredients.
steps.description: In a large bowl, beat the sugar, melted butter, eggs, mashed bananas, yogurt, and vanilla with a stand or hand mixer.

steps.headline: Mix the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Use a medium bowl to combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt with a metal wire whisk.

steps.headline: Incorporate the two bowls.
steps.description: Sift the dry ingredients into the wet ingredient bowl. For the best results and easier stirring, sift a small amount at a time between stirring.

steps.headline: Fold the chocolate chips in gently.
Fill a doughnut pan.
steps.description: Add the batter to the cavities of the pan, about 3/4 full.

steps.headline: Make the topping.
steps.description: Combine the cinnamon and sugar in a small bowl. Sprinkle the topping on the batter before baking.

steps.headline: Bake the doughnuts for 12 to 15 minutes.
Allow the doughnuts to cool.
steps.description: Leave them in the pan for a few minutes.

steps.headline: Transfer the doughnuts to a wire cooling rack.
steps.description: Set aside for about 15 to 20 minutes.

text: Making the Batter Preheat the oven to 325°F (160°C).  Mix the wet ingredients. In a large bowl, beat the sugar, melted butter, eggs, mashed bananas, yogurt, and vanilla with a stand or hand mixer. Mix the dry ingredients. Use a medium bowl to combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt with a metal wire whisk. Incorporate the two bowls. Sift the dry ingredients into the wet ingredient bowl. For the best results and easier stirring, sift a small amount at a time between stirring. Fold the chocolate chips in gently.  Baking the Doughnuts Fill a doughnut pan. Add the batter to the cavities of the pan, about 3/4 full. Make the topping. Combine the cinnamon and sugar in a small bowl. Sprinkle the topping on the batter before baking. Bake the doughnuts for 12 to 15 minutes.  Allow the doughnuts to cool. Leave them in the pan for a few minutes. Transfer the doughnuts to a wire cooling rack. Set aside for about 15 to 20 minutes.
sentences: Making the Batter Preheat the oven to 325°F (160°C).
In a large bowl, beat the sugar, melted butter, eggs, mashed bananas, yogurt, and vanilla with a stand or hand mixer.
Use a medium bowl to combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt with a metal wire whisk.
Sift the dry ingredients into the wet ingredient bowl.
For the best results and easier stirring, sift a small amount at a time between stirring.
Fold the chocolate chips in gently.
Baking the Doughnuts Fill a doughnut pan.
Add the batter to the cavities of the pan, about 3/4 full.
Combine the cinnamon and sugar in a small bowl.
Sprinkle the topping on the batter before baking.
Bake the doughnuts for 12 to 15 minutes.
Leave them in the pan for a few minutes.
Transfer the doughnuts to a wire cooling rack.
Set aside for about 15 to 20 minutes.
